title: Variables
summary: In programming, a variable is like a labeled box where you store data. You give it a name (the label) and put a value inside (the data). This allows you to reference and manipulate that data throughout your code.
sample_question: Imagine you are making a game. Give me an example of what you would use a variable for.

title: Loops
summary: A loop is a control structure that repeats a block of code as long as a specific condition is true. This saves you from writing the same code over and over again. Common types are 'For Loops' (counting) and 'While Loops' (conditional).
